results.title: Fitness leader exercise encyclopaedia
results.creator_credit: Bill Edmonds and Australian Council for Health, Physical Education and Recreation
results.brief_description: Designed for trainers, coaches, physical educators and other fitness leaders. Shows over one hundred exercises and sequences and explanations of correct and incorrect techniques. All exercises and sequences are numbered for quick and easy references and grouped for major muscle groups.

results.title: Fitness for Tennis - Stan Nicholes
results.brief_description: Hosted by Australia’s international tennis champion, Tony Roche (the man responsible for coaching Ivan Lendl on the restructuring of his game), this unique video gathers together some of the world’s tennis greats: Ivan Lendl, Martina Navratilova, Bjorn Borg, John McEnroe, Ken Rosewall, Pam Shriver, and others.

results.title: Fitness for sport
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sports training film series”.
This film shows how to attain the basic physical fitness which all sportsmen need for success - whatever their sport. More than fifty exercises are demonstrated and a squad of athletes is taken through a training session devised by a former Polish Olympic athlete to develop mobility, elastic strength and endurance. Written and narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Fitness for living: how to get fit
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Eric Horter
results.brief_description: This film shows ways of getting fit and suggests that regular practice of specific exercises is the key to developing strength and endurance; that slow continuous exercise such as jogging or bicycling develops the heart and lungs; that weight training augments muscle strength. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Fit to fight
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, Army Kinema Corporation and Gordon Stewart
results.brief_description: The physical training of the British Army, showing how it is carefully planned to help every recruit to reach his own individual peak of fitness. Explains the necessity for this high standard of physical well-being by showing how the training relates to different activities in the field.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, Army Kinema Corporation and Gordon Stewart

results.title: Fishing on the coast of Japan
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Depicts the rigorous existence of Japanese fisherman. This film is non-narrated with Japanese music serving as the background. Shows the preparation of the nets, men and women pulling the boats into the sea, look outs for fish, the final catch, return home and the unloading. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Fishing across Canada
results.brief_description: Screen Magazine: Herring from the river: fishermen-farmers of the Gasperaux Valley in Nova Scotia catch herring upriver. Fish below the ice: Cree Indians of northern Manitoba fish in wintertime by stringing nets between holes in the ice. Home for young trout: to stock mountain lakes in the Canadian Rockies, fish are raised in hatcheries, the largest in Jasper National Park. Salmon on the run: on Canada’s west coast, commercial fishing vessels haul in huge catches. A glimpse of the of the multi-million-dollar salmon industry of Canada’s west coast.
